name: scout kerchief
notes:
**find the free version of this pattern [here][1]!**

scout kerchief - small but mighty. 

the scout kerchief might be small, but it is the perfect statement accessory. it is comfortable and lightweight, which makes it a great piece to wear year round. but why stop there? this pattern includes tips and visuals to help you modify the size of your kerchief so you can adjust the sizing as you like, which makes it perfect to make one for the whole family - including a matching one for your pet to wear as a bandana. ;) 

this pattern uses about 200 yards of fingering weight yarn, so dive into your stash and get ready for this fun and quick little project! 

visit [www.woodsandwool.com][2] for the free version of this pattern.

pattern + download
- please note this listing is for a pattern only. 
- pattern is written in us terms. 
- pattern includes written instructions as well as a schematic, stitch diagrams, and tips to modify the size of your kerchief.  
- this pattern will be delivered via email in the form of a digital file (pdf) upon purchase. 

skill level
- crochet pattern
- this pattern is ideal for an advanced beginner. it is beginner-friendly, but does require some knowledge of basic stitches and pattern reading. 

yarn
this pattern uses about 200 yards of fingering weight yarn. it's perfect to use up yarn in your stash, or you can try one of my favorite budget-friendly fingering weight yarns!

copyright 
the scout kerchief pattern and photographs are property of woods and wool and are for personal, non-commercial use only. you may not alter, share, or sell this pattern in any way. however, you are more than welcome to sell the finished product. please credit woods and wool by including a link to the pattern listing if selling the finished piece online.

share your work 
follow along on instagram at @woodsandwool! tag @woodsandwool and use the #scoutkerchief hashtag to show off your beautiful new kerchief!


  [1]: https://www.woodsandwool.com/free-crochet-pattern-scout-kerchief/
  [2]: www.woodsandwool.com
